meanings.definition: To make a mistake or error.
meanings.sent1: She keeps flubbing her lines during the play rehearsals.
meanings.sent2: I hope I don't flub the spelling test tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: He flubbed the recipe by adding salt instead of sugar.
meanings.sent4: The comedian flubbed his joke, but the audience still laughed.
meanings.sent5: The student's constant flubbing of math problems led to lower grades.

meanings.definition: To bungle or mishandle a task.
meanings.sent1: The chef was flubbing the preparation of the dish.
meanings.sent2: I always seem to flub important presentations at work.
meanings.sent3: She flubbed the surprise party by accidentally revealing it to the birthday person.
meanings.sent4: The team flubbed the final play, costing them the game.
meanings.sent5: His constant flubbing of responsibilities led to his demotion.

meanings.sent1: He kept flubbing the guitar chords during the performance.
meanings.sent2: I tend to flub simple tasks when I'm nervous.
meanings.sent3: She flubbed the dance routine but managed to recover gracefully.
meanings.sent4: The quarterback flubbed the pass, resulting in an interception.
meanings.sent5: The actor's flubbing of lines caused delays in filming.
